alert.note: Alert for Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 7:17PM CDT until April 07 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Arkansas... Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, APRIL 07... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing. * WHEN...Until Friday, April 07. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, in Mississippi, the river is touching the levee at many places near Mhoon Landing. The road to Stubb`s Island is closed. Fields are flooding inside the levee west of Seabrook Road. Water has reached the outlot of McKinney Bayou Pumping Station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.4 feet Monday evening. - Action stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
